subject: Sleep
title: Brain Waves of Each Stage
description: One-minute skill: Brain Waves of Each Stage.

hook.text: Your brain produces different electrical frequencies depending on your sleep stage. Each has a signature wave.

buildup.text: Wakefulness shows fast, low-amplitude beta waves. As you relax, slower alpha waves appear.

discovery.text: N1 brings theta waves, N2 adds sleep spindles and K-complexes, N3 produces slow delta waves.

twist.text: REM brain waves look almost identical to waking brain waves. The sleeping brain mimics being awake.

climax.text: Each wave pattern reflects a different kind of neural processing, from memory filing to tissue repair.

punchline.text: Your brain speaks in waves, and each stage has its own language.

quiz.question: Which brain waves dominate deep N3 sleep?
